review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable hiking shoes I’ve ever had. I feel confident wearing them in almost any environment all day.
review.name: Comfortable and durable

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Excellent fit right out of the box, with no break-in required. Good traction, and the fact they're waterproof helps a LOT in rainy/cold weather. 

However, after more than a decade of buying and wearing Moab boots, I'm a little disappointed in them lately. I've had two pairs over the past 18 months or so that have had stitching come loose on them within a pretty short period of time, including this pair. Obviously, this means the parts come loose and they're no longer waterproof.
review.name: Great fit, but possibly some quality issues

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's

description: Buy the Kali Protectives Chakra Solo Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chakra Solo Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kali Protectives Chakra Solo Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This helmet is a perfect example of why it's a pain to buy things like helmets, shoes, etc., without being able to try them on first.  It's a nice-looking, seemingly well-built helmet, but for me it was very uncomfortable in two areas (1) the strap design is bad, as they seem to get in the way and are awkward to get right before putting it on, and (2) once it was on there were two ridges in the top rear of the helmet that dug into my head. Maybe I've just got a weirdly-shaped noggin, but Giro offers comparable helmets at similar prices that are MUCH more comfortable.  And they're available in enough stores locally that I can try them before I buy them.  I'll be sticking with those from now on.  

Now I get to pay another $6.99 in return shipping for the privilege of getting to try on a helmet that I would have immediately rejected if I was at a physical store.  Not a great policy, Backcountry--I'm not going to be buying any other "wearables" from your site.  Not worth the inconvenience and "trying on surcharge."
review.name: Uncomfortable

name: Chakra Solo Helmet

review.reviewBody: Instead of writing glowing promos, why didn't Competitive Cyclist tell us that SIDI has changed it's sizing format? I've worn 46 SIDI for 20 years and now this shoe is too loose in the heel, and the 45.5 is too tight. CC know this, but says nothing except 'Why we like this shoe." Well, I bought some top end Lakes that developed hot spots in 6 months that also had glowing CC reviews.  Now my SIDIs don't fit. How about I just stop buy shoes from you guys?
review.name: Wish I had returned

review.reviewBody: I have worn Sidi for more than 25 years.  I ordered the same size 46.5 that I have always worn.  The fit was good but I couldn't make the heal adjustment tight enough to prevent my heal from lifting.  I decided not to buy them.  I was also not convinced of the ease of using the two center mounted closures.  They were awkward to use.  I own two pairs with one center mount and one side mount closures and I find they are easy to use.
review.name: Something changed

name: Shot 2S Road Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Arcane 30L Duffel Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We searched high and low for a diaper bag big enough for our twins and toddler items. It's big enough to carry clothes, diapers, a changing pad, an insulated first aid kit for our epi pen, and six chilled bottles in an insulated pack. But it's not so big that it's unwieldy. We wanted something that didn't scream "diaper bag" and would be versatile for other uses as the kids grow. It's held up really nicely to the elements and still looks new a year and a half in.
review.name: Twin Diaper Bag...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this bag so much. For someone who travels this bag is perfect. Fits everything I need for a week and a half trip. The computer slot holds more than just a computer, I put hard drives or even books in there with it! ALSO FITS FOR SPIRIT AIRLINES. I have packed this bag full and still will fit in their bag slot! Everyone in my family has this bag, I have gotten it for my boyfriend as well and he uses it for every trip. Couldn’t recommend more!
review.name: I love this bag so

review.reviewBody: This is a great bag for everyday travel. I would buy it in other colors as well.
review.name: Great Duffel

review.reviewBody: Great pack for everyday use and travel. I do wish it had more pockets, but the ability to carry multiple items for either travel or every day use is amazing. Super comfortable carry.
review.name: Great every day pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Downpour Eco Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a men's medium in everything.  The medium in this jacket runs SMALL - no room for a fleece or sweater under it.  Returned it and will order a men's size large.
review.name: Downpour ECO men's rain jacket

review.reviewBody:
I tried this on and returned it immediately. I'd describe it as a Slim or Alpine fit, definitely not "Regular"! This is especially important for a jacket that you will often wear over other layers. 

Other than that, the jacket seemed pretty nice. The sleeves and back were good in terms of length. The zippers and snaps felt like good quality. The hood adjustment seemed well designed. The material felt similar to other high-end waterproof + breathable membrane shells that I've had, although I didn't do any testing on the waterproofness.
review.name: Runs Small! Seems high quality

review.reviewBody:
I never write reviews but I wanna save other people from making this mistake.
First off the features on this jacket are good. The drawstrings on the hood work very well pockets are big and the jacket fits well.
The issues is this jacket wets out immediately! I took it in light rain a few times and it soaked through within minutes. For a jacket called the downpour you'd expect some water resistants. Not sure if I got a bad batch but was horrible.
review.name: Wets out immediately! Decent features

name: Downpour Eco Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Peruvian Fleece Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Peruvian Fleece Hat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Peruvian Fleece Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am so happy with this hat. It’s exactly what I was looking for. A thin warm hat that covers my ears and fits under my bicycle helmet. Thank you sooo much!
review.name: Fantastic cycling hat!

review.reviewBody: I ordered a large but extra large would probably have worked if available. It wasn't. I was pleased with weight and feel of the beanie and would have found a niche among my hats had it fit.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: I love this hat! Although very thin it is incredibly warm as the liner totally seals out the wind. Better yet the hat is sort of "stretchy" and thus does not move around on your head. I really like this style of had because it allows you to leave earflaps up or put them down according to weather conditions. Trouble is the two previous hats of this style I've owned are constantly shifting around on your head and the flaps wind up blocking you vision. As I am a photographer that pretty much kills the deal.
review.name: Best hat I've ever owned!

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly over Head, Ears and Back of Neck. Stays in place and the adjustable Under the Chin Strap guarantees that it's going nowhere. Stows away in any zippered pocket or Stash Pocket ready for the Cold and Wind. I really enjoy this Cold Weather Head Gear. Take it with me anytime Cold and Wind are sure to present themselves. Great Product.
review.name: Lightweight Headwear Ready for The Cold and Wind

review.reviewBody: I purchased the same hat 20 years ago and recently lost it. The new model pales in comparison to what I originally purchased - thinner material, weaker stitching, less durable feel.
review.name: Low Quality Replacement

review.reviewBody: Great hat except for one thing. If the large size was about 20% "bigger" it would be awesome. Slightly tight and because of Goretex it doesn't stretch much Otherwise it's awesome
review.name: Needs to be a bit "bigger" to be perfect

review.reviewBody: This hat is warm, windproof, lightweight and easy to pack. What now could you want???
review.name: Best hat ever

review.reviewBody: I wear it fishing over my ball caps. Very warm and helps hold my hat on running down lake.
review.name: Love this hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i use it daily on cool or cold days while commuting with my bike. it keeps my ears warm and that's the most important thing a hat can do in my opinion. with other hats, sometimes they don't cover my whole ear, so the bottom of my ears freeze to death.
review.name: keeps your ears warm

review.reviewBody: I thought this hat would be more substantial. I couldn't believe this hat was in the package when it arrived. What I was hoping to be a serious Winter hat turned out to be a thin, minimal, sporty hat meant more for running or as a helmet liner. It does have a strong seal around your face but this also acts like a tympanum (like a stethoscope) to magnify rubbing or tapping near your ears. Fit on the headband was too tight for my 23.5 head. I would definitely size this as L rather than L/XL.
review.name: The Micro-Bikini of Peruvian Hats

name: Peruvian Fleece Hat

review.reviewBody: I purchased two pairs and the colors are great and add spice to any kit. The material is sturdy  but the calf sizing/foot is a bit off. I by no means have monster calves but these are difficult to pull up and over, and during a 2-3 hour ride they do tend to slip down.
review.name: Creative Colors

review.reviewBody: First time trying DeFeet. Was excited to add another pair of funky socks to my collection. Quality seemed par for a cycling sock. However, the cuff does not have a whole lot of stretch, dare I say none. I struggled to get pull them on and knew they weren't the right fit. I have bigger calves and after a long ride that restriction is no good. if you are more of the Euro fit they are probably great.
review.name: Cool sock for the right fit

review.reviewBody: I wear a US size 14 and an XL fits great with these socks. Hold us well as I have had a few pair for over a year now. Somewhat hard to get on, but feel great on foot. The part that goes up your leg is somewhat sturdy and feels secure.
review.name: I have come back for more pairs twice!

review.reviewBody: These socks are just what I wanter.  They came quickly, fit well, and look sharp.
review.name: Great Socks

review.reviewBody: These socks are some of my favorite MTB socks! I am all about less skin being safe skin, so I love how high these come up. They don't slide down at all and the vents probably do a great job, but alas, my shoes don't really let me find out. Such fun colors and patterns!
review.name: Fave MTB Sock

name: Aireator 6in Sock

review.reviewBody: Good boot if you can get them on. I have the Legacy model, 12 inch height. The ankle area is very narrow making it difficult to slip your foot in, even when folding the calf shaft down as low as it will go. I have to wear insoles for an arch lift and cushion, this further narrows the canal for my foot to slip. It would be great if XtraTuf would mount loops on each side of the ankle area (inside, low) to assist in pulling on the boot, would be great. I suppose I can wear the boot if a soak my foot in oil to aid slipping it in, but that’s not a good idea.
review.name: Good boot if you can get them on.
comment:
Hello,
We are sorry to hear that your new boots are not the right fit! We want to be sure you are satisfied with your purchase.  Please reach out to our support team. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Great boot little tight around calf only reason for 4 star
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: Use for spraying chemicals around my house, they’re fully waterproof. Definitely would buy again
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody: This was exactly what I wanted. I really appreciate that the company helps support the disabled. Needing only the right shoe due to an amputation it was a blessing to get a discount. Thank you!
review.name: Great company and product

review.reviewBody: These are too narrow and fell apart within 1 year. I have had several pairs in the past and fit perfect and lasted several fishing seasons, now, not so much. I have always worn a size 12 and due to being much narrower, I have to wear a 13 and they are just way too long.
review.name: Not made in USA
comment:
Hello Dan,
Sorry to hear you are not satisfied with your new boots.  We do offer a 1 year limited warranty.  Please reach out if you need any assistance.  We appreciate your support.
xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Bought to convert my dual bike rack into a triple and it's working great. I like the fact that this is a stable and sturdy rack that I've used to transport 3 ebikes with ease.
review.name: Great product and sturdy

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to go with my Monorail Solo Bike Rack.  I love the Monorail, so I assumed this would be a great addition that would allow me to carry an additional bike.  Same sturdy construction as the Monorail, but the attachment method from rack to rack is horrible.  There is about six inches of metal that slides into the existing rack, then two bolts fasten it together.  The problem is after 15 minutes of driving around with no bikes loaded, the bolts start to wiggle themselves loose, and I don't mean just a little loose.  I was nervous loading my 20 lb gravel bike on it to get it 5 miles home from the bike shop.  I contacted Backcountry and they were super helpful as always.  They immediately ordered me a replacement unit and sent me a prepaid code for my current one.  I'll update the post when I receive it and get it installed.  Hopefully I just got a factory dud.
review.name: Meh

Couldn't find these in my size anywhere on the inner webs until I hit up Motosport.com! Killer price too!
Had to buy two pair!

review.reviewBody: I've had these shoes for a little over 2 weeks now. I got them because I wanted something more water resistant to wear while biking. I also need support or my back and feet start to hurt because I'm 37 but have the body of a 73-year-old. As far as what I bought them for, they work just fine. Plenty of water resistance in the rain, but they're not waterproof. I spent 5 hours power washing a friend's driveway in 50° weather and by the end of it my feet we're cold and wet for about 2 hours. As far as support goes, the insoles they come with her decent. You could probably put some upgraded ones in and get more time on your feet out of them. The soles offer plenty of grip for what weather. Not so sure about ice yet. My major complaint is fit and finish. I spent $130 something dollars on these shoes and expected them to be a little bit more technical than they are, but mostly I expected them to be of decent quality. See my attached pictures for issues with fit and finish. I'm finished edges, glue spatter, stitches starting to come undone after the first wash, I expect more out of $130 pair of shoes.
review.name: Good shoe for medium/light duty

review.reviewBody:
I am a Backcountry Gearhead and was seeded a pair of these, but I aim for an unbiased review. I came away with loving them and not wanting to take them off! I have been sleeping on Icebug, but no longer. Note: I have a lot of winter trail running experience and run a lot in the snow and ice. 

Initial impressions: These were truly comfortable right out of the box without excessive dead space, and true to my size. The last is supposed to be on the wider side, with a roomier toe box. I found this to be true when comparing to my more narrow Salomons. 

The mango is a fun, bright two tone orange. These have a cool upper mesh honeycomb material that is closed cell (no visible holes) to the naked eye which is supposed to be breathable and water resistant and seems like it would be a durable material. A spongey mesh tongue. A classic stiff rock plate on the sole. A toe with a hard ridged piece for protection. On the sole there are diagonal lugs, not overly tall (a bit shorter than my Speed Crosses), with 16 studs spread evenly throughout mostly enveloped in rubber with just a sharp flat tip protruding.

I wanted to compare these in the field with the trail runners I know and love, the classic Salomon Speedcross 5s. They both have similar drops (9mm for Icebug vs 10mm for Salomon). I took both on a run/hike on an unseasonably warm early November day on a rocky trail with some mushy snow up top and steep slick, bouldery sections and switched them to try them both out climbing and descending. While both were great on the ascent, the Icebugs really shined on the steep slippery descents where traction is key.  

Immediately, these felt lighter on my feet and super comfortable. I instantly felt secure in the slippery snow and rocky sections. I hiked back up and changed to my Salomons and definitely felt the difference - less friction and noticeably more slippery in the snowy sections. The Icebugs are a bit strange feeling on rock, but still have excellent grip on hard surfaces. I felt comfortable making my way down a steep rock slab - it’s just that they will click given the studs.

One thing to note is that these are not insulated so if you are running in very cold conditions such as 20F and below, I would recommend neoprene or thicker merino socks if your feet tend to get cold. 

Who would these be great for? Anyone that runs on trail or snowy roads and wants amazing grip in a lightweight package. I would try to limit any running on hard surfaces such as road/extended rock as it sort of has an unpleasant feel and you’ll wear them down quicker. However, do know that Icebug awesomely will send you replacement studs free of charge and they have the replacement directions on their website.
review.name: Wonderful in the Snow and Ice and More

name: Pytho6 BUGrip Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I like these better than the original Ghost.  I was having discomfort in both of my Achilles heels and my lower back.  Usually when this starts to happen its a sign that I need new shoes.  When I purchased these, the pain completely went away within a few days.  The improved cushioning is amazing.  I also think these are more stylish than the original Ghost.  If Brooks is going to continue this line, I plan to purchase these moving forward.  Definitely recommend.

review.reviewBody: I ordered a wide shoe and my god these things are so comfortable. I like the gray with the blue. Shipped to an APO too which I always appreciate.

review.reviewBody: Not much support, definitely lacking in cushion, feels narrow, rubbing my baby toe. Gonna have to switch these and stick to the superior reliable fit and comfort of the Glycerine.

I contacted you and the person, yes an actual person, could not have been nicer or more helpful resolving the problem. They made your company really stand out. I am so glad the actual shoe I also great as I plan on being a Brooks customer for a long time.
review.name: Great Shoe and Great Company

review.reviewBody: My brother raves about these sneakers and how it provides so much comfort, so I decided to gift a pair to my boyfriend just in time for his family trip to Europe. Now my boyfriend raves about how comfortable these sneakers are. I may have to buy a pair for myself.

Very comfortable 
Nice design 
Either walking ,  or going for run  it’s a great fit

review.reviewBody: I found a pair of perfect shoes in the Dyad 11. Unfortunately those are discontinued. I've purchased the recommended Ghost Max, Ghost 16 and now Ghost Max 2. Each shoe gets further away from the Dyad 11. The shoe induces supination while the more significant heel drop makes one feel as though they have to roll over the mid foot and on to the fore foot. I sent them back.  Maybe the shoe is fine on its own, but it is the antithesis of the shoe it was recommended as a replacement for and going the wrong way.
review.name: The wrong direction

review.reviewBody: My comments are about walking. The ghost max2 extra wide is comfortable and has a cushioned feeling. They feel great, I'm over 65 and these are very much appreciated. Thank you! Brooks

review.reviewBody: So different than the Dyad. Not sure if I like them yet

So far so good. Have had them for a couple weeks now and my foot pain I was experiencing with the Adidas shoes is gone. They’re very supportive. Will probably be first of many Brooks running shoes for me. Mostly worn for work and walking.

comment: We are very sorry to hear about the issue with the Spotlits that you have been having. We would be happy to troubleshoot to see if we can fix the issue that way or by replacing the lights through our worry-free guarantee. Just fill out the Worry-Free Guarantee form on our website or via email at info@niteize.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought it for my boy pup and tried the disco mode love it only thing u had to buy the cord separate to it should be together other then that nice and bright at night

review.reviewBody: I loved the product when it worked. But unfortunately it no longer holds a charge and doesn't stay on without being directly connected to a power source.
review.name: Stopped working after 2 weeks of use.
comment: While we hate to see that your Spotlit has stopped working after only two weeks, we are happy to help you out with this. We have a worry-free guarantee here at Nite Ize that covers all our products for up to two years. If you just reach out to us at info@niteize.com or fill out our Worry-Free Guarantee form on our website we can get a replacement Spotlit sent your way.

review.reviewBody: Just where does one acquire the Micro USB cable needed to recharge the rechargable battery? It woud be nice if this information was provided up front! What is the product ID? What am I looking for? Where do I look for this cable? Do you also sell it as a accessory for the SpotLit?
review.name: Micro USB cable? What cable? Where available?
comment: Hi John, there is a great chance you already have a Micro USB cable at home. It is a pretty common charger for different household items, that you can find at most convenience stores, gas stations and on Amazon. As long as you type in Micro USB into the search bar that should be the first charger that pops up. If you are still having trouble finding one, just reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we would be happy to help you out!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased one almost a year ago, and it’s wonderful! I turn it on for every evening and bedtime outing. It lasts about 3 days on one charge, and it’s easy to recharge. I haven’t had any issues with the charging aspect, unlike some reviewers. 

We have a large amount of yard fenced in, so it gives me peace of mind to be able to find him in the dark (and make sure he’s behaving!). It’s so bright and visible. 

I love this product so much, I bought another one for our newest pet. We’ve had it on her for a couple months now, and it works great. I love that I can make her a different color than his, so I can see who is who in the farthest, darkest parts of the yard!

I recommend it to all my pet friends.
review.name: My favorite product!

review.reviewBody:
I havent had this even a year and never charged it - i thought it needed batteries until i took off the cover and noticed the charging port- it turns red for about 30 seconds and stops charging 
Super disappointed since only got a few mths usage
review.name: Very shory lived

review.reviewBody:
Hello I wanted to write a review about your amazing customer service.
I emailed regarding the Spotlit clip for my dogs. I was having issues with the clips breaking after only being used a couple of times.
I got an email reply from Zach and he asked if I still had the receipts which I did. He also said if I didn't have the receipt he could replace one as a one time exception that falls under their worry free guarantee. I found the receipts and emailed him the copies. He replaced my clips for me and I got them in the mail really quick, thank you so much.
I just wanted to share my experience and a big shout out to Zach.
review.name: Customer service

review.reviewBody: This product is absolute junk!  I purchased one and it worked for a few weeks - then nothing.  I bought another one - worked about 2 days.  I contacted the company and they sent me 2 of the rechargable type.  Guess what?  They worked for a few days and then - quit!  I give up!  Should have read the reviews prior to purchase - many have had the same experience with this product!
review.name: Garbage
comment: Hi there, I am sorry to hear about all of the issues you have been having with the Spotlit. I would be happy to go through some different replacement options with different light up products for you. Just reach right back out to us so we can make this right.

review.reviewBody:
The spotlight seemed to be a great little light, it's bright, easy to use, convenient, and changes colors. So, what else could a customer ask for? How about a product lasts more than 11 months, and can survive being charged more than a handful of times? The spotlight was always clipped to the front of my dogs harness even when it wasn't being used. The spotlight was never submerged in water, or any other hazzared one might think could kill an led light. I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed. 
So, if you decide to pull the trigger and purchase a spotlight my advice is to wrap it in bubble wrap, and keep that receipt close.
review.name: I USED IT FOR EVERY NIGHT WALK... UNTIL...
comment: We are sorry to hear about your Spotlit becoming faulty on you, we would be happy to help you out by getting you a replacement through our Worry-Free Guarantee. If you reach out to us at info@niteize.com we would be happy to go through what we need for the Worry-Free Guarantee and some helpful troubleshooting tips to keep this light lasting longer.

review.reviewBody: Not working anymore, I might have had it for five months before it quit. Took me a while to find the receipt because I moved, but hopefully I will be able to get a replacement and see how that goes. Same issue as most, will work on charge but not when it is taken off the USB cord, it does a yellow/green flash when charging and will let me use different colors only while charging.
review.name: Great light at first...
comment: We’re sorry to hear about your SpotLit not working after only about half the year. Luckily we do have a worry free guarantee that covers all the products for up to two years. Please reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we can go through what info we need to get you a replacement SpotLit!

review.reviewBody:
This fits excellent, we have more than enough "^" shaped jackets on the market (e.g. patagonia) I have broad shoulders, a muscular upper body, and a narrow waist and this fits fantastic, I have the medium and it hits right on the belt-line which is perfect length for a jacket, vs a coat which I want to land mid thigh. Oh I'm 5'9, 20" shoulders, 46" chest, 24" torso length, 32.5" waist. 

The material on this is ultralight and soft, good drape. Layers over L1+L2 great, though I wouldn't try a layer 3 under it unless you size up. It layers under an insulating L3 great and doesn't catch on outer garment armholes if you're throwing a denim or flannel over for an abrasion/dirt layer. The eco-dwr works the same as the dwr on my older or ferrosi, this is all you need in 99.93% of use cases, leave the goretex for exposed mt-top adventures. If you're in the desert or the forest or the city or below the snowline on a mt, this has got your back.

I want to see the industry make more jackets without toxic dwr, and more jackets for muscular dudes, so I really can't praise this enough.
review.name: I'm buying a backup rn.

review.reviewBody:
Bought size L which was too large but could have been a keeper if the pants fit. Just too oversized, especially in and below the shoulders. Not an issue given the lightweight materials but it's just kind of bulky and baggy.

Materials and construction were great. Features wise, I think it would benefit from an adjustable hood. Also the flap above the zipper pockets looks unsubstantial and ineffective (although I did not use it personally). In person it detracts from the overall visual appearance much more than in photos.

Would have kept if they fit; I just wish the size chart was more accurate, especially considering that this is an in-house brand.
review.name: Cool but did not fit me

review.reviewBody: I've been able to use the light weight rain jacket on a couple hikes. It's durable, breathable and easy to pack.
review.name: Great lightweight durable rain jacket

review.reviewBody: These boots are ready to go anywhere. I have used these in many high alpine situations. They are sturdy enough to handle heavy loads of the pack. Strong enough to kick steps into steep ice glacier fields. Summited many mountains. The real test was Chimborazo and they did the deed. If you tend to have weak feet. These might hurt until they are properly broken in, but in all, they keep your feet warm with the proper sock. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great boot to have in the gear closet

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned Asolos, Zamberlans and lots of my long time favorite Scarpas…in particular their Charmoz and Zodiac Tech models which compete directly with the Salewa Crow. Before receiving them I wasn’t too optimistic about the Crows, thinking Salewa was a purveyor of somewhat lesser quality. But I was wrong. This is a well designed and well balanced product, so they’re quite adaptable. Really enjoying them, very satisfied. Already bought a second pair.
review.name: Very satisfied

review.reviewBody: Out of the box this boot looks great, the extra sole insert makes for a customized fit. Very stiff not much bend initially. I wear a 8 street shoe and the 8 in these fits like sneakers, slightly narrow. Might want to half size up if you’re planning on wearing thick socks. They seem super durable and I expect longevity out of these.
review.name: Best boot I have pwne

review.reviewBody: I have real bad ankles and feet from skateboarding, mt bike racing, motocross racing and other fun sports growing up and the support these boots offer is unparalleled as I compare to other hiking, trekking and light mountaineering boots I have bought in the past.  The rigid sole transfers that foot/ankle energy to my calf, knee and thigh which keep the pain at the lower end of the scale.  I just got back from Everest Base Camp and they performed exceedingly well. They tend to fit a tad bit small like Asolo boots but are super rugged.  Pre EBC training was about 400 miles and they have an additional 200-300 more miles since returning and by the images, you can see that they are in pretty good shape from a wear perspective.  I tie by boots so tight that I blow through laces every 150 miles but these still look new. I attempted to buy back up "factory" laces for these boots and was told by all sources that they are not available. Only bummer. I have not had the moisture intrusion problem I have read but have not trudged through deep rivers and ponds.  The hundreds of streams and puddles never yielded any leakage. I did bail the factory insole for a custom orthotic.  The only area where these may not perform so well would be on flat long treks. I have done the Camino de Santiago twice and would not bring these. The super rigid sole causes you to "clop, clop, clop" when you walk which may make other areas of you body hurt over time.  Even though there is still more than 60% tread left and a 90% outer skin, I am going to purchase another pair before they change the model and put them in the queue.
review.name: The best boot I have found to date

name: Crow GTX Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I've been a loyal fan of ExOfficio underwear ever since my 2-year backpacking journey through Europe and Africa. The durability, comfort, and quick-drying nature of their original product made it a staple in my travel gear, proving its worth even years later.

However, my recent purchase of 8 more pairs for an upcoming Southeast Asia trip left me disappointed. The material has changed making them slightly rougher, and the sizing now runs on the smaller side. A word of advice: size up. In addition to the material and sizing changes, ExOfficio's decision to alter the elastic on the waistband and leg openings is a significant downside. The new design not only compromises the comfort that was once a hallmark of their underwear but also introduces an unwelcome issue of visible panty lines. It's disappointing to see these modifications detract from the overall quality and wearability that initially drew me to the brand. Unfortunately, I realized this after washing them, making returns impossible. Change isn't always an improvement, and it's disheartening to see a once-reliable product undergo alterations that impact its performance.
review.name: Mixed Feelings
comment: Hello, thank you for leaving the review on our product. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion. We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: I like a little bit more compression to my underwear (more snug/form fitting). These were loose and very breathable but to the point of feeling baggy. I don't think sizing down would have worked because the waist fit perfectly. These are just not form fitting underwear which makes them difficult to exercise in.
review.name: not for me

review.reviewBody: I love how durable these pants are. The fit is awesome and they move great. The material is a bit stiff which helps with durability but not softness.

review.reviewBody: I'm so happy about the rugged material these are made with. They're comfortable, a little stiff at first, but I'm sure they'll break in nicely. Loving the pockets and design of these pants. Also, I found customer service to be Excellent! I definitely am thinking of buying a second pair.

review.reviewBody: Ordered 2 in different colors, love them both! Fit is great, feels really durable. Great for indoor climbing, curious to know how well they breath outdoors though.
review.name: Great fit, great colors!

review.reviewBody:
I loved everything about the style of these pants -- except how they looked on me. The material and elastic are super sturdy and the color combos are so good. 

I am 5'4" / 125 lb and the small was a bit too tight in the thighs and the medium was too large at the waist. Both sizes could have been about 3 inches shorter, as there was a lot of fabric bunched up around the ankles. If you are taller with a slim build, these would probably be perfect!
review.name: Great climbing pants, weird fit

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these! The ankle elastic feels sturdy and super thick for rolling up and actually staying in place no matter how high you bunch it up.

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: These pants are way too tight in the hips. I had to get a 38" waisted pant to accomadate my 33" waist and a 41" hip measure. The "Improved Fit" is literally the opposite. I shouldnt have to go up two whole sizes to get hiking pants that can accomadate the range of motion involved in walking up stairs. Also, why is the 30" inseam 31" inches long? My old 34" by 30" vidda pros fit fine. My only positives are that the materials and construction are solid, and it's nice to have the pant slimmer in the calf, but thats the only improvment. The fit is unforgivebly restrictive.
review.name: The "Improved Fit" ain't it.

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve worn the trousers in heavy rain + high altitude in late autumn and encountered no problems whatsoever. They’re light hence one doesn’t sweat much yet warm enough.
review.name: Trousers for heavy use in autumn!

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these pants. They’ve become my go-to pants and the fit is great. I took the advice about sizing and ordered a size larger and they fit perfectly. I recently ran into a friend from Finland and he was also wearing a pair of Fjallraven pants. We commented on how rugged they are.
review.name: Great Pants

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have 3 pairs of fjallraven pants all similar and each of them are great. Purchased their wax as well for the extra water proofing when I need it. Can't go wrong with these pants
review.name: Fjallraven is the best

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: I find them to be too restrictive when I’m taking a big step or climbing over and up something.  Good otherwise but the sizing and cut is just too tight for me.
review.name: Too restrictive

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love it . 
Fit well, very comfortable, very nice
review.name: Highly recommended

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought these and the Vidda pro ventilated. Same size but they fit differently 
The lite fit more like a 33 waist and the ventilated was tighter in the waist and hips.  
Both are great but it strange the sizing is so different in the waist.  Pants a great and nice a light fabric. 
Great for Arizona nights and days.  Wish the sizing was more consistent.
review.name: Awesome but be wary of fit.

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these pants for hunting and ended up using them for construction type work.  They arecthe most comfortable and durable pants I have ever worn. I'm going to be adding a few more of these to my collection.
review.name: Comfy and durable

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The pants seem well made overall, but since they are not a stretchy material, and i have 
 above average athletic sized quads/thighs, when i go to do a high step in these pants it feels as if im going to rip the pants. It makes me sad because they fit in the waist and feel great when im just standing up straight. But if i have to go up stairs or do anything where i need to raise my leg more than a walk, the pants become way to tight around my thighs.
review.name: Thighs are too tight

review.itemreviewed: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these 6 months ago and initially thought they were excellent.  I wore them during a long distance hike in the Scottish Western Isles over the summer and have done various hill walks since.  The quality of the construction and features are excellent but unfortunately the material is not robust / durable enough to withstand Highland Scottish walking where they come into contact with rough heather and granite paths etc..  They tear very easily in the areas where they are not re-inforced.  For their price, I expected better value - they are supposed to ' last a lifetime' but sadly it wasn't much longer than Liz Truss's lettuce
review.name: Well made, great features, not robust enough.

name: Vidda Pro Lite Regular Trouser - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a men’s down vest and men’s shirt-I received 5 pairs of socks instead of the correct order! Had to make 3 calls to NOT pay the sick restock fee and get a refund ASAP! ZERO STARS
review.name: SENT WRONG ITEMS!!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago. Such a game changer for every day and golf that I bought two more pair to sit in the shelf.
review.name: Best daily shoe ever

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: There's a cheap touch and a lot of glue traces. They got a strange look, like something wrong with them. Maybe they are manufactured defaults, but I don't think I gonna wear them. They are not sooo comfy like the description pretend. Really disappointed.
review.name: Disappointment
comment: Thank you for your feedback regarding the ELIXIR ACTIV MID GORE-TEX. We're sorry to hear that they did not meet your expectations in terms of comfort and quality. Your comments are valuable to us, and we will share them with our product team to ensure we continue to improve our offerings.

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I usually use wide shoes and was afraid I was going to have to make a return. Fortunately I can assure these are somewhat wide as standard and have had a very comfortable fit from them.
review.name: ultra light & comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like these boots. I wanted to switch to lighter boots after wearing heavy and sturdy backpacking boots for many years. Elixir Activ is almost twice lighter, but my feet felt just as much support as in the heavier boots. Unfortunately, the tip of the nose started to peel off just after two hikes. I hope warranty will fix this.
review.name: Really like the boots

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Second pair, very comfortable shoes. Great for outdoor activities or chasing the wife down at the mall. Keep up the graet product.
review.name: Great Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had these boots for a few weeks now and very pleased with how waterproof they are, also they are extremely comfortable for long walks.  Where they do fall down is on mud, it’s like wearing roller skates which is  unusual looking at the tread which seams good.
review.name: Excellent in the wet, not so good in the mud

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent! Properly wide and very supportive, comfortable and accept my custom orthotics well.  look good:
review.name: You won’t regret

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this about a month ago and so far I can’t be more pleased. Lightweight, nice toe box and great lugs for steeper terrain.
review.name: Great hiking boot for the summer!

review.itemreviewed: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought them for an Icelandic trip. Very comfortable, could walk with them all day. The issue he is that they are not water proof or resistant.
review.name: Not water reistant
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

name: Elixir Activ Mid GTX Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I'm so in love with these clogs. Very comfortable. Wasn't sure whether to size down to an 8 as an 9.5 but the 9 fits pretty well with not too much wiggle room. Definitely styling these with socks more than barefoot. Stylish, comfy for casual wear, and a nice level of platform so you're not ridiculously tall but also you feet stay dry if you're trapesing through puddles. I just got them, so I can't speak to their longevity but they seem to great quality and don't scratch easily.
review.name: LOVE LOVE LOVE

review.reviewBody: The fit is perfect and they are very comfortable. I can wear them with anything, jeans, shorts and dresses. I have been wearing them to walk my dog as well as out and about running errands. Love the color.
review.name: Love my shoes

review.reviewBody: I got the pink caribou women's clogs. I love them! They're so cute! I call them my barbie shoes. However, I have to admit that it's not very good to stand in in the operating room. They haven't broken in very quickly and after a few weeks they still aren't the softest. This is ok, but I moved on to Hoka's in a hospital setting. I don't remember where I saw that these would be good for hiking or medical work (they're more for fashion and general walking), but the reviews that say so are for different sorel shoes. I guarantee it.
review.name: Wonderful Look!

review.reviewBody: The CARIBOU™ Women's Clog is so very comfortable and chic and functional. They are fun to wear with denim jeans and brown corduroy  pants. Perfectly compliment nice hefty socks while keeping your feet clean and dry. I highly recommend CARIBOU™ Women's Clog and would love to be able to find them in more colors!!
review.name: Fun & Functional

review.reviewBody: I loved the look and color. I got my normal Sorel 8.5 and my toes hit the end of the shoe. I then got the 9 and the length was fine but my foot swam in it.  There was no way I could keep my foot in the shoe.
review.name: Wish it worked
comment: Hello Regular girl, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our CARIBOU™ Women's Clog is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: ❤️ clogs. Very comfortable. Wear after a long day of standing on concrete floors. I wear with no-show socks.
review.name: Recovery clogs

review.reviewBody: Looking forward to using these during the rainy and cold season
review.name: Wish there were more colors

review.reviewBody: The 8 fits in the bed, but the lip on the back side of the heel is barely beyond my step while I walk and the 9 I just so big. I am keeping the 8, but wish this came in an 8.5 as it looks other colors come in half sizes. Maybe I should have kept the 9, but they looked ridiculous. I also got some crazy blisters on the top of my foot from walking too far in them. Obviously wear with socks for a while first!
review.name: Wishing for a half size.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and waterproof. Great color and wearability
review.name: Looking forward to wearing them

review.reviewBody: Love these! Perfect for every day wear, gardening, outdoor swimming and everything else. Great colour and make me look on trend
review.name: Better than Crocs

name: Caribou Clog - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Betalight 45 Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Betalight 45 Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Betalight 45 Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was really excited to try this pack based on the design and fabric. Unfortunately the hip belt is so thin that it’s useless and may as well not be there, so I returned it. It may suffice if you’re only carrying 15-20lbs, but anything over that and the whole pack sags and draws on your shoulders. I’m a lightweight AT & PCT thruhiker so have tried my share of packs and miles.

I really like the pack fabric, which drives the price up, but did seem very durable and extra bonus it’s waterproof. Pack design is the pretty standard two side pockets and one front, which held plenty of gear in the outside. I liked the wide roll top opening.

The two stay suspension seemed like overkill given that the hipbelt is so thin and flexible that it won’t support any weight transferred from them to it. BD might as well cut weight and have just one stay. Then add some high-quality foam and perhaps some rigid plastic to the outside of the belt to help it hold 20-25 lbs much better. Even if a couple ounces more due to the above, I would have kept the pack.

The shoulder harness was fine, I like the vest style. The foam in the should straps did end pretty short, but was still comfortable.

Some of the stitching (around the harness edging, top of front pocket) seemed lower stitch-count and quality than I usually expect from BD. I hope they’ll update these soon with a real hip belt and I’d consider it again.
review.name: Nice fabric but the hip belt is a joke..

review.reviewBody: Just hiked Mt Kilimanjaro with the Beta Light 45 pack. Super light for a long trek. The harness is amazingly comfortable and with the pockets great for cameras, GoPro's, etc... It handled the rain well, 100% of my items remaining dry. Highly recommend this versatile pack.
review.name: KJ Hike - Awesome Pack

review.reviewBody:
I use to have osprey rook 65l, somehow i am able to fit more stuff in this backpack and still have room for other stuff.
TOTALLY WORT IT FOR THIS MONEY.
review.name: Worth IT

review.reviewBody: Bought two high end packs and carry them both. I will post results after a month or two.
review.name: Going head to head with hyperlite southwest 55

review.reviewBody: I have’t had a chance to use it yet but incredible attention to detail and I put weight in it and it’s very comfortable. Very cool way they put the back pad in an outer pocket. I will do a full review on my channel AlpineEarth.
review.name: Awesome pack

review.reviewBody: The Large size Betalight45 fits me very well. The shoulder straps are comfortable with a loaded pack and the hip belt sits properly to take some weight. I'm 6'3",180lbs, my torso is 21.5-22" according to BD instructions. I measured the actual volume of the main bag to be 46L and still able to roll closed. Side/back pockets will be additional capacity.
review.name: First impression, great pack

name: Betalight 45 Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Scarpa Mago Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I decided to give scarpa another chance after buying and being disappointed with the Vapor V. The magos didn't need a lot of time to break in and fit well but were uncomfortable enough to have to be removed after climbing a route. The sensitivity was sub par and I was disappointed with how soft the overall shoe was. It couldn't toe or heel hook well. I wouldn't suggest buying it and expecting to improve on limestone climbing.

Sizing: I'm a US 10.5 street shoe and wear a 41 EU in La Sportiva and bought a 41.5 EU Margo and fit perfectly.
review.name: My Least Favorite Aggressive Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have not owned any shoes with this aggressive of downturn profile before the Magos and I wish I would have done so sooner. My toe sticks to whatever I put it on with ease in these. I only break them out for steep Boulders and Sport routes and they make a huge difference. I have 9.5 street shoes and bought them in 41 which is a half size bigger than I normally go for climbing shoes. This was key as they are SNUG with the extreme downturn. They broke in fairly quickly too which was nice because the first couple times using them I could only handle one Boulder before taking them off to give my feet a break. Lastly I will say I have no qualms with the heal at all as I know many say there is a lot of dead space. It?s snug and heal hooking is no problem for me. 100% recommend!!
review.name: Steep game changer!!

name: Mago Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these to hike in Alaska and they were perfect! Pockets held my documents and my phone/camera no problem and they held up beautifully even to light rain!
review.name: Great Hiking Tights!

review.reviewBody: I really wanted these to work, but just wearing them around the house is painful, I can’t imagine actually trekking in them. The seams where the material differs, ie the patch over the backside, dig into my skin and chafe so badly. I even tried washing them to see if there was any improvement—but it only made it worse somehow. I really like Patagonia and have a ton of their products but they missed the mark on this one. I’d return them if I still could.
review.name: Seams are incredibly uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I REALLY wanted to like these- they checked all of the boxes; thicker, durable fabric, great pockets, beautiful color... but the color blocking just did not flatter as a good legging should! The seat of the pants really flattens your "assets". I also wish there was a drawstring for the waist. In the end, they would be 'fine' in a pinch, but didn't love them enough for the price!
review.name: Just OK

name: Pack Out Hike Tight - Women's

review.reviewBody: These thing are last for multiple ski seasons. . . awesome!
review.name: Perfect multiseason ski workhorses

review.reviewBody:
Good gloves which are very well designed. 
They do seem to be cut just a little snug.
review.name: Good gloves.

review.reviewBody: Nearly Indestructible can handle hundreds of rappelles, rock centric environment and warm in stormy environments
review.name: Nearly Indestructible can handle hundreds

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair for myself and now I'm buying these for friends and family. These are, hands down, the best gloves on the market today. They are comfortable and durable. They are very warm! The waterproofing is excellent. These are the gloves you've been looking for.
review.name: The best gloves on the market

review.reviewBody:
I have owned 3 pairs of the guide gloves. They are the most durable gloves i have owned. The additional leather patch from the thumb to the forefinger is great for those who remove their skis to ride the gondola, as the edges will not rip through them. The stitching has never un raveled on these gloves.
My only knock is they are not as warm as you might think. They make a lobster guide glove i own as well for colder days, recommend that as well.
review.name: Very Durable

review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago when they first went on sale. They were an absolute steal! The quality is incredible and my hands are warm all day!
review.name: Best gloves I’ve ever owned!

review.reviewBody:
I got these for over 50% off and only wore them on one cold day in April so I can't say if they will withstand super cold temps and seasons of skiing and worth full retail price. However, they were warm that day and seem like a great pair of gloves. MUCH better than Hestra's. That brand is highly overrated and not worth the hefty prices. 
Regarding sizing, they are a bit on the smaller side. I bought a Large(my normal size) and an XL and I still went with a Large hoping they would stretch a little. The XL's could have worked but I felt I lost a little dexterity in them.
review.name: Legit ski gloves

review.reviewBody:
The XL fit perfectly, I chose one size larger because I take the glove off and on at the ski area.  I like the internal liner with Gore-Tex; easy to dry after a day of snowboarding. 
Gloves came with NikWax Creme Waterproofing Wax for Leather.
review.name: Excellent Glove

review.reviewBody: My old BD gloves of 20 yrs are finally wearing through. They kept my hands perfect at -20 on Denali and have served me well as a XC ski track groomer. The new ones I just got for a killer deal thru BC look even better. Wow. These should last for another 20. Thanks BD and BC. You guys are awesome! I switched from L to XL because a glove like this should not be snug.
review.name: My second pair in 20 yrs

review.reviewBody: I bought them online, fit perfectly, and have an internal liner but can use another liner as well. very flexible and slow movements to grab the ice axe.
review.name: Perfect fit, 100% high end item

name: Guide Glove - Men's

description: Buy the UGG Tazz Suede Slipper - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tazz Suede Slipper - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the UGG Tazz Suede Slipper - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: BEST SLIPPERS! LOVE THEM!
review.name: THE CUTEST!

review.reviewBody: I was nervous about the platform but actually love them!
review.name: Favorite ever!!!

review.reviewBody: The shoes is not as comfortable compared to Tassman. Moreover, the heel part is flat so kinda slippery
review.name: I have 50/50 feelings with this

review.reviewBody: My heel consistently slipped out and wouldn't fit back into the shoe. I would have to push my heel back in and pull the shoe back up. Size 11 was huge, and size 10 was a bit small. I wish they made half sizes, and I wish they made the back of the shoe the same as the Tasman. The platform also isn't very comfortable. I exchanged these for the regular Tasman and they fit and feel like a dream.
review.name: Heel slips out and sizing is off

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my granddaughter's 17th birthday. She wanted these so bad. I'm sure she will love them.
review.name: Birthday gift

review.reviewBody: Was a little tight so I gave this pair to my daughter and ordered a size larger for myself. All in all so cute and definitely worth it
review.name: Loved it!!

review.reviewBody: I've wanted to try these for awhile so I decided to purchase a pair for myself as I was buying a pair for my sister's MOH gift. I was so excited when they arrived - I tried them on and was walking around for a few moments before I quickly realized these would never work. My heels were slipping completely out of the back with every step! So then when you step down again, your heel crunches down on the inner heel of the shoe. Searched online and found a ton of similar reviews. Such a bummer but definitely not worth the money. They need to improve the design of the heel for these. I did order a size 10 and the shoe fit perfectly for me, so not a sizing issue like many others have had.
review.name: Terrible design

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable nice material; I would have given 5 stars but there is a slight dent in the suede on the toe of one shoe, I haven't worn them yet but I'm hoping it evens out.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: Can't wait for the weather to get cool so I can wear them outside
review.name: I would buy them again

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and cute! Perfect indoor and outdoor shoe! Size down.
review.name: The perfect shoe

name: Tazz Suede Slipper - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good climbing tape. Does what you want it to and is quite sticky. Better than meticulous tape for sure
review.name: Climbing Tape

review.reviewBody: A little bit big, but will be useful during the long haul.
review.name: Climbing Tape - Full

review.reviewBody: stays on even though i have extremely sweaty hands
review.name: stays on even though i

review.reviewBody: Pretty much what you would expect. No surprises, just quality climbing tape
review.name: It’s climbing tape

review.reviewBody:
Sticky very well to skin and itself! Bends fantastically. I let others people use it on occasion and all of them ask me the type for them to look for it!!!

Doesn't tear very easily so I prefer to cut it. But it does tear down the middle decently 🤷‍♀️. 

This item is good for all levels of use.
review.name: Very effective!

review.reviewBody: Short answer is it's tape. It sticks fairly well to the skin most of the time. I do find that the ends don't always stick well and I find myself having to cut off the ends frequently throughout the day. Occasionally leaves some residue on the skin but comes off easily with soap and water.
Any climbing tape is better than medical tape, plus it's split to fit your fingers already to make it easy for ya!
review.name: Why not?

review.reviewBody: Their climbing tape is very grippy and not too hard to tear.
Enough said. Next time you buy any of BD's excellent product line, toss one of these in your cart. Support them tendons.
review.name: It's Tape

review.reviewBody:
Seems like pretty normal climbing tape, but found the adhesive to be sub-par for myself. It started peeling 10-20 minutes after application and subsequent projecting and was totally stretched out, useless and needed reapplying after 45 minutes. 

If you're looking for an all day'er I would highly recommend Metolius' climbing tape. Stays sticky even when wet and just feels better
review.name: There are other better tapes out there

name: Climbing Tape

description: Buy the Burton Supreme Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Supreme Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burton Supreme Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Supreme Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burton Supreme Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've worn Burton snowboard boots for over a decade and they are the only ones consistently that fit my calves for comfort. My previous pairs were the Ritual with Imprint 3 liners, which I loved. The new Supreme model comes with the Life liner, which is the top tier of choices. I got them later in the season so didn't get as many days in them as I would have liked. They are quite stiff, as described, so I haven't quite figured out the correct tightness for the inner lining versus the outer lacing. That's why I give them a 4 instead of 5 stars. These are taking a bit longer to find the perfect tightness for the liner to fully utilize its glory on my feet and calves. With them being stiffer than the Rituals, I know they will last a bit longer before they start softening too much and need to be replaced. Plus, a little extra stiffness for the steeps and other technical terrain is not a bad thing. In the end, I wouldn't trade them for any others and look forward to the season kicking off.
review.name: Supreme is Queen

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing Supremes since they came out nearly 20 yrs ago, so I've had a number of pairs. This is the ugliest, most cheaply built, ill-fitting pair of boots I've ever owned. The rubber toe wrap is useless (they were plenty durable before, and the glue seams wouldn't be more durable kicking into the hill), and constricts the shell - there's no give to the front of the boot, or the instep. The liner is nowhere near as premium as it used to be. The J-bars hit in a weird place compared to other brands. I went through extensive boot fitting and I still can't wear them. Gigantic waste of $600, a morally reprehensible price for snowboard boots, especially when tbey are no better than the $400 version.
review.name: Worst iteration of this boot yet

name: Supreme Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's

description: Buy the Stoic Fleece-Lined Legging - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fleece-Lined Legging - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Fleece-Lined Legging - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fleece-Lined Legging - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Fleece-Lined Legging - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I had long since sworn off fleece lined leggings having only found them to be ill-fitting and ultimately uncomfortable. I have been wearing a pretty heavy Smartwool ever since. But these were so purple-y and - god help me - i just wanted to give fleece leggings one more try... and... 

SUCCESS!

They are cozy and comfortable around the house, of course, but they really crush it in cold weather. Took them out for a spin in 30'ish degree rain and even after the front of them got wet, i stayed warm and felt dry & comfy. Fabric is super durable and high quality and they are well constructed. I am absolutely a fan!
review.name: Exceedingly Dope Leggings

review.reviewBody: I wore them today on a cold trail run, it was in the 30s and they kept me toasty warm and they have great stretch and comfortable.  I got xs and it was true to size.
review.name: love these legging

review.reviewBody: I was on the fence about these but am going to go ahead and return them. They are a bit high and tight in the waist (I can roll it down, but it is not stretchy enough to be comfortable and adds a roll) and they are about 1.5" too short in the ankles. I know if I went from a M to a L, they would be too baggy in the thighs.
review.name: Too short, and too tight in the waist

review.reviewBody: 5'2, 120-125lbs, ordered a small and it's too big despite reading other reviews. Positive is that they are heavier/thicker than I anticipated.
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: These are my go-to warm leggings! They fit perfectly, are warm, can be layered, and hide my cellulite. I seriously can't say enough good things about these pants! I'm 5'5" and fluctuate between 130-140 lbs and these always fit!
review.name: I have 3 pairs of these!

review.reviewBody: I was excited about a winter legging but the fit is way off. I ordered a L as some reviews mentioned sizing up, but I had to return and order my normal size in M. The M is baggy in the front, back of the knees and it does not fit to the leg at all. I'm not sure what happened with their sizing but I would not recommend.
review.name: Fleece-Lined Leggings

review.reviewBody: I got these mostly to wear with sweaters when the weather gets colder, but so far I've only worn them around the house. They're super soft and stretchy. A little long for me (5'3") but that's fixable. I'm looking forward to wearing them more as the weather gets colder.
review.name: going to be perfect for winter

review.reviewBody: Love these new leggings for cold days layer on the mountain and then look cute on their own. Don't look bulky at all like some of the thicker fleece leggings do and very comfortable. i'm 5'8" 140-145lbs, and the M fits perfectly.
review.name: My new go to for thermal layer

review.reviewBody:
I’m talk with larger thighs. I followed other reviews and sizes up one to a large and it was the right choice. They’re a little big on top but because of the adjustable waist band I think they will work. 

I have the Athleta polartec fleece lined leggings in a medium tall and these are similar. The material in these is a little shinier and thicker which will probably repel dry snow better and they runs shorter. But for $20 I consider these to be a real winner
review.name: Very Good

review.reviewBody: These leggings are warm and cozy and the styling is great. The buttery soft fleece lining adds warmth and comfort. I use them for hiking, lounging around the house as well as going out to dinner. I have used them several times and they still look brand new. I sized up one size . The waistband gives a comfortable fit.
review.name: Best leggings I've ever worn!

name: Fleece-Lined Legging - Women's

review.reviewBody: I got 3T for my 2 year old fits a little loose but perfect for layering and 6 for my 5 year old. The perfect warm jacket that isn't bulky.
review.name: I would buy it again

review.reviewBody: Very cute winter jacket! color is bright and clean.
review.name: My daughter love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: So cozy for my three year old son and he loves the color!! Great for Midwest fall weather
review.name: Cozy toddler jacket

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the quality of the Denali jacket. It is a thick fleece, perfect for colder weather without being extremely bulky.
review.name: Great fleece!!

review.reviewBody: I've been purchasing this for my son every year since he was 2. He loves it, we love it, it never gets old. It's lightweight but so warm and comfortable. I only took a star away because I noticed the fleece on the jacket seems thinner/cheaper than previous years.
review.name: Fall/Winter Staple

review.reviewBody: I remember wearing the Denali Jacket as a kid so seeing this amazing design brought back for me and my family as an adult has been so fun! I was able to buy me and my daughter starting kindergarten matching purple and pink fleeces for the school year. I feel so blessed to have been able to do that for her and I. Thanks so much for the sign up discount! Love you North Face!
review.name: Timeless Quality & Design

review.reviewBody: My son loves his fleece and it looks super cute on him!
review.name: I would recommend this product

review.reviewBody: My lil Bumble Bee loves it!

hasVariant.name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Such a comfortable bag that provides security of warmth, room to wiggle, and soft touch. Would highly recommend this bag for those who have varied camping adventures, from car to mountain.
review.name: Never a doubt

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this bag. The gills are what sold me. I bought the Disco 30 degree bag and have now used this bag for more than 100 nights and it still looks and performs like brand new. The are so many features that allow you to control the temp inside the bag so no matter what you can sleep comfortably. This bag packs up small and compact making it easy peasy to put in your backpack. The stuff sack is perfect as I have seen a lot of companies that use one that is super small making it difficult to store away. Not the case with Nemo. The stuff sack is good size making it super simple to stuff back into the sack without wasting a lot of time fighting it. I am going to be buying the 15 degree Disco next. You can't beat this bag and I highly recommend this to ANYONE.
review.name: Best bag on the market hands down!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this Sleeping Bag! It is so warm for those cool nights in the mountains, but the vents make it comfortable for warmer nights. Super small and lightweight also!
review.name: Versatile Bag!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: This sleeping bag is great for side sleepers with plenty of room for your knees. It has very soft materials and is very comfy.  I only wish they had more color options as the gold isn't that appealing.
review.name: Roomy sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great bag. Just picked it up recently. Works really well, lots of room and really enjoy the vents. Also the colors in the latest version are solid
review.name: Love this bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this bag, and now that it has arrived I am grateful that I did.  I have not purchased a down bag for about a decade and needed to replace my old 30 degree bag. I love the features on this bag such as the heat vents and the draft collar.  I also love that it has hydrophobic down that will not absorb moisture. I have found it very comfortable to lie in, and it is amazing how small it packs down too in the provided compression sack.
review.name: Comfort and Great Features

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 6'4" and a side sleeper.  The spoon shape provides plenty of room without forming cold pockets. I was skeptical of the Thermo Gills.  My first night with the Disco was warm and unzipping the gills performed exactly as promised keeping me comfortable in the bag.  The second night was 32F and closing the gills kept me warm without cold spots around the gills. The Thermo Gills are awesome!
review.name: Great backpacking bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great Bag! Purchased for backpacking and canoe tripping. Packs down very small. Very light. Love the spoon shape - roomy and less restrictive than most mummy bags. Great for side sleepers.
review.name: Great Backpacking Bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great bag! A must for side sleeper some. Highly recommend this
review.name: Highly Recommend!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I don’t really think of sleeping bags when I imagine something being as being “technical” but the calculated design decisions of NEMO gear, especially their bags, make me reconsider. I want to shout out the thermo gills. This is a feature I don’t think I can go without now that I’ve tried it. Overall this is a great bag, the materials feel premium and it is comfortable to sleep in. It’s also incredible how NEMO takes responsibility for the lifecycle of their endless promise products. I don’t see myself taking advantage of that for a good long while but I can sleep better at night because of this bag and because I know it won’t end up in a landfill.
review.name: Not just a sleeping bag

name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these boots with the intention of doing more urban walking/hiking in my area while wanting a pair of boots that will also keep my feet dry. These have proved to be exactly what I was looking for! I was cross shopping between similar style boots but ultimately wanted something on the less expensive end to try out. My only issue is that it seemed like one of the boots was already broken in a little/ slightly looser (maybe someone already tried it on?) but after a few uses on my own, it's much better.
review.name: Perfect pair of urban walking/hiking boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Grateful for these boots that braved Machu Picchu's rain and cold, keeping my feet comfortable on every step of this unforgettable journey
review.name: Comfortable boots

review.reviewBody: Nice look & feel too! Color excellent w jeans or with grays, khakis, & blues. Looking forward to Fall & Winter weather protection.
review.name: So pleased !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how easy it is to get these boots on and off - perfect for camping and getting in and out of the tent! The little bit of stretchy fabric and loops to pull them on are great quality - with other brands I feel like I might rip them apart, but these are solid. I also appreciate that they are waterproof with good grips for hiking. These are my new must haves for any outdoor activities!
review.name: Comfortable, dry, and easy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfortable and waterproof. Perfect for cold and windy days.
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great value.  They were a bit tight at first, but have adjusted fine with wear.  Very comfortable and easy to put on and take off.

review.reviewBody: Bought this rain jacket to replace another brand’s jacket that had ripped. So far, the material seems very high quality, I’ll be surprised if it gives out anytime soon. Breathable, comfortable, waterproof, lightweight, packable, and came in a very pretty color. Extremely pleased with this purchase.
review.name: Great rain jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket is loud which makes wearing it during activity like running or biking hard to hear other things. I wish the sleeves were longer for biking. Other than those it’s a good fit and great for light rain and having an emergency jacket in the pack.
review.name: Loud jacket but good fit

review.reviewBody: This jacket exceeded my expectations. The colour and size are accurate and it fits me perfectly. Its waterproof and more lightweight than I would have imagined. It also packs down super small.
review.name: Awesome rain jacket!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for our wet and rainy soccer season with the kids. Don’t leave the field soaked like before in other jackets and looks great
review.name: Wife loves it

review.reviewBody: Great fit, cut just right to be sporty and not cut in a gimmicky/hourglass/overfeminine way as many womens' products are. I ordered my usual size, and it is a little snug for layering, the stretch accommodates movement despite it's snugness, but think about sizing up if you're planning to layer a lot under it. I love the anorak style, losing the bottom half of the zipper saves weight and makes it more packable, and glad they didn't eliminate the pockets. Can't comment on the waterproofness yet but it seems to walk the line of durable but still light and flexible. Would recommend.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Excited to use this gear soon in the Pacific Northwest trail system area
review.name: Dry even when it's wet

review.reviewBody: Appreciate the availability of small sizing options. I usually wear size 2-4 and the XS fits perfectly and leaves room for a couple of thin layers underneath. Love the stretch. Color is beautiful blue shade.
review.name: Appreciate the availability of small

review.reviewBody: I haven’t tested it in rain yet but the fit is great and the length in the back seems like it would protect you well from rain without restricting movement. The hood is excellent if you want to wear a helmet or have big curly hair like I do. I love the color and wish the stormline jacket came in this color, because sometimes I want to be able to unzip versus having to pull it over my head.
review.name: I haven’t tested it in

review.reviewBody: So far I like every BD product I have purchased. This anorak has a nice shape. I ordered XL. I like that the sleeves are on the long side because they don't fly up when I am active. The fabric is thin, flexible, and waterproof, allowing me to chose my layers underneath. Today it was 20 degrees and I layered a wool base layer and then an ultralight fleece layer. Also I had a vest but took it off when I got warm from skiing. There are no pit zips. The giant zipper helps release heat but not as much as pit zips. The hood is large but you can cinch it and fold it back. It kept flying snow out of my eyes so I like the hood. The best feature is the big kangaroo pocket which not only has enough room for big mittens, but also has a perfect secondary pocket within to keep your phone near your belly, not flopping around or falling out. It fits my iPhone pro max. Love that pocket. I include photos to show this green color, which is an unusual color but I don't hate it.
review.name: It's dry and it has a big pocket

review.reviewBody: Needed a new rain coat and wanted something breathable and light but with hardcore waterproofing, and this coat is exactly that. The lightest raincoat I’ve ever worn, super breathable, and very rain tested/waterproof so far. Love the sealed seams/zippers too. Love this coat.
review.name: The rain coat I was looking for

name: Stormline Stretch Anorak - Women's
