review.reviewBody: What is going on with the colors of the women's trail running line??? It's impossible to find a nice colorway. These all look like men's. I love my Mach 6, Clifton, but wanted to replace my Torrent for a long time and I can't find a colorway that I can look at it for longer than 2 seconds without giving me eyesore. We want neutrals, black upper on light midsole and feminine colorways! Thank you.
review.name: Dear product line manager no more eyesore colorways

review.reviewBody: Feel so much better in my walks wearing these; imo hokas are always easy to break in without blisters or rubbing, one of the best shoe brands out there. I will be ordering another pair. I a
review.name: Easy to break in

review.reviewBody: Hoka are the best shoes I have ever owned. Extremely comfortable & supportive. I wear my Hoka shoes to the gym, hiking or just walking. Perfect!
review.name: Fantastic Shoes!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely loved the Speedgoat 4s. Yes the tongue was an issue, but overall it was a great shoe for me. The 5s were awful. You can fold them in half. Pick up a pair and try. I like more support underfoot and the 5s were way too soft. The 6s are great and closer to the 4s than the 5s. The traction is super secure, similar to the Mafate. I will run in the shoe because it works for me, but I absolutely hate the colorways. Obnoxiously overdone. I wear an 8.5 street shoe. I always wear a 9 in Hoka and it's the same for this shoe. I like a bit of extra length and have never lost a toenail.
review.name: Improvement from the 5s

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Speedgoat since version 2, skipping the year of the slicing tongue, loved the 5s. The 6s are a complete overhaul and it's not a good change. Most important is sizing changed, I was a 7.5 in previous Speedgoats, so that's what I ordered, they are too short. I should have gotten an 8, my toes hurt. Second, the tongue, why do you always change the tongue? Now it has an elevated/thickness right where you would tie the shoe, then the tie will slip unless you tie it very tight, then it feels like you are bruising the top of your foot while running. I don't understand the purpose of this change. I ordered Gull/Stormy skies color, it's interesting, wouldn't have selected if I saw it in person, I think it has snowflakes. Some positives: I like the heel cup, if feels more fitted, less pebbles are getting in my shoe. The improved grippiness of the soles are good. They are grippy. I'm really bummed with the changes and in the market for some new trail shoes.I think I waited too long to return so will probably have to sell them, unfortunately.
review.name: Loyal Speedgoat user for years and so disappointed

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes! It's my very first pair of Hoka's I have ever bought and I will definitely be buying them in different colors!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

review.reviewBody: This is her primary running shoe and she says it feels like she is running on springs!
review.name: I bought these for my wife and she loves them!

review.reviewBody: Didn't do anything crazy with them, but there's two spots where they have started to come apart. Just did a 4-day trail run around Wonderland and this is the result. Not the typical quality I expect when buying Hokas.
review.name: Coming apart after only 93 miles

review.reviewBody: I heard the new Speedgoats went down in quality but i ignored the complaints. I needed new fall trail running shoes so took a trip to R.E.I. to try the new Speedgoat 6, being a fan of the 5s. I was expecting to walk out with a pair of 6s, but the complaints were valid! They were shockingly uncomfortable! They are stiff and run small. They still had the Speedgoat 5s in the store so my friend and I put them on side by side. The 5s are roomier and the material is much softer. The material on the 6s felt like cheap plastic and when I sized up they fit the toe box but then rubbed on the heel. I tried on the Stinson 7 instead, which also didn't workout. They're plush on the foot, but stiff around the ankles and way too heavy and stacked for a trail running shoe. I was so disappointed. I ended up with the Challenger 7s, which are very comfortable, but I was hoping for a more technical quality trail running shoe. I feel like I should backstock the Speedgoat 5s...otherwise I might need to switch to a different brand. Hopefully the quality improves next time!
review.name: So disappointed...

name: Speedgoat 6 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I 5'9" 175# ordered a size Large, comfy but the waist is too big! Velcro doesn't work as good as the Fox defend ratchet adjustment.
review.name: Weird Fit

review.reviewBody: Quality of these pants is top notch, wish they would've fit. I'm a 34waist, ~33inseam and purchased the XL. Waist was a little loose out the bag but the Velcro straps enabled perfect fit. I have bigger legs so usually the XLs fit my legs but are loose on my waist. Unfortunately these were too tight from just above the knee down- even my slim knee pads didn't fit under them. They were also short. Bottom of legs fell quite a bit above my ankles. If POC made a tall version or a bit more width through the legs on their XLs, I for sure would've kept them! Knew without riding in them they had to go back.
review.name: Need a tall version

review.reviewBody: I love these pants.  They were a little big for me, but don't think I would have been able to go down to a medium.  There is what appears to be a glued seem in the crotch that opened up after the first ride or two.  I initially thought it was a vent, because the pants were brand new and were not tight on me.  Upon further inspection before the third time out, I saw the seam had opened up.  I went to return them but it had been longer than 30 days.  I don't wear these pants except at the park and by the time I was 3 rides in, apparently it was over the limit.  I loved everything about these pants, I guess I'll try to repair them and keep wearing them, but I'd have trouble recommending them to anyone else or buying a second pair, which I was inclined to do before I found the bad seam.
review.name: Defective

review.reviewBody:
These are awesome. Super comfortable, tough knees and quality fabric all around, sizes for knee pads, taped seat area so there is zero chance of getting wet. Look and feel awesome. 

There is a mesh retainer inside the right pocket to hold the phone if you forget to zip up or leave open for ventilation. 

For climbing in warm weather, I unzip the lower leg and roll it up to use like shorts.
review.name: Superb

review.reviewBody:
I bought these for cold weather riding and have had a couple opportunities to take them for a spin in temps from low-40s to low-50s. What attracted me is the vent-zipper/pocket upfront for temp regulation. Also the ankle sipper is a really nice feature. I'd say 50 degree is probably tops for me, otherwise I start overheating on a pedally ride, even with the vent open. With kneed guards I'd probably not wear them above 45, but I do run a little warm.

I have a 33 inch waist and a short-ish inseam for my height and the fit for a medium is good but not perfect. The inseam is actually spot on, but the waist is a little bit loose. The velcro adjustments are the achilles heel for the whole package....they're just kinda flimsy and don't hold that well for a premium product. These pants are basically a ratchet strap away from being perfect, as the material is super nice and they're comfy for cold weather pedally rides and otherwise look great.
review.name: Nice cold weather pants

review.itemreviewed: Course Air Lite XZ Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had to go a half size larger than the the size I've worn forever. 44.5 to 45. If the wide was available that would have been perfect. Boa working both ways to tighten and loosen is a must too and these have it. They're lighter than my last pair of Shimano that were worn in enough and needed retirement. Time will tell on how they last for me.
review.name: niiice shoe

review.itemreviewed: Course Air Lite XZ Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Picked up a pair last year, at the reduced price,  and they have held up great. They are one of the most comfortable shoes I have worn in a long time.  Pretty good even in the hot weather rides. I would def. consider this shoe as a future replacement.
review.name: Great fit, have worn well.

review.itemreviewed: Course Air Lite XZ Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These shoes are the very first pair of shoes that offer a proper fit and a solution for when your foot sweals. First of, I have a collection of insoles, from Solestar to Sidi memory and none have soled my numbed feet issue. Well, I came across these shoes and scored! Is worth to mention: remember I mentioned I have all those fancy insoles?... these shoes have some insoles that are just like jelly, no structure or support at all. Thus, at first you may think this is not going to work. Such insole goes against everything the cycling market tells us about foot stability and so forth. However, is all about the shoe, my knees are just super straight and the foot feels amazing. Now, I was thinking that such comfort will come at a high watts price. I was wrong, I use a power meter and my power increased tremendously. They dont feel as stiff as a pair of S-Works but the power meter is there to prove I push about 30-40% more power with ease. 100% recommended! 
Cons: I have tried to find the proper torque to tight the cleats and there is absolutely no information anywhere. I think there is something regarding the left shoe above the cleats that I can feel on my feet. A little discomfort but cant compare to numb feet. So I just ignore it.  
Size: I am size 10 in sneakers or 9.5 in sleeper shoes (if not 10 as well). I ordered size 44 and is just perfect. You always want to have some extra room on your too box for your toes to expand.
review.name: Most comfortable shoes ever had!

name: Course Air Lite XZ Cycling Shoe - Men's

My go to Rain sneaker. Super comfortable 
, roomy, and a must have for when you need to be out in the rain.
review.name: Travel Sneaker that’s stylish and keeps you dry

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was unhappy with my previous running shoe as they didn't seem to give enough support. I used the Brooks app to find something better suited to my needs and ended up with Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX (I wanted the Goretex version for winter rainy days). They are a great fit and I can really feel the support from the side bars as well as the cushioned sole. They feel good to run in and have helped me better my personal best over 5K.
review.name: Very good shoe - great support.

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not a runner but a heavy walker for both work and play (city as well as dirt trekking) and over the last year I've tried all of the main brands sold at feet first type stores; the Brooks are hands down the best for all day wear.  I have 3 pairs of the GTS23 and got the GTX for rainy day urban exploring
review.name: Stop searching; this is the shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super Lightweight. Could use a little more cushion. Have not had any wet conditions to try out in yet.

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sizing is all wrong. This is the second pair of gtx sneakers I have tried and both were too small. I have been wearing the adrenalin for years, and have several pair size 11. It seems that the extra layers of material that make them waterproof also take up the volume in the sneaker. Can't just add the gortex or whatever Brooks uses without changing the size of the shell. To bad because I love my Adrenalins but wearing them in a NE winter is impossible.
review.name: Disapointed

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I’ve been running in the Brooks Adrenaline GTS 23 and loved them, but the GTS 23 GSX truly adds something extra. The fit is perfect – secure yet comfortable – and the cushioning feels incredibly soft on long runs. I noticed the added support keeps me stable without compromising flexibility, and the grip handles both road and light trails with ease.

If you’re after a stable, comfortable shoe that delivers a smooth, pain-free experience over long distances, the GTS 23 GSX is an outstanding choice. Brooks really outdid themselves with this model!
review.name: The Perfect Upgrade for Long Runs

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Lovely shoe, relieved that the fit has not changed, adrenaline has been serving me well for years. Despite this being GTX version I feel they are decently breathable
review.name: Happy returning customer

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great running shoe with all the support and comfort you need for your daily runs

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These are seriously the best shoes I've ever owned. I bought a pair after being continually disappointed with the other "Sketchy" brand and will never go back. I just had a hip replacement surgery in July, only a week later I put on my Adrenaline GTS 23 and was walking between ½ a mile and 1 mile regularly. Now I'm up to 5 miles a day and I have no for or knee pain(or hip pain). 

Also, most other brands rely on memory foam insoles to be "comfortable" but that's definitely not the case here.
review.name: Best shoes ever

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are waterproof but the soles are rock hard. I was hoping they would feel like the regular version of the shoe but sadly they do not. The size is about a half size smaller than the regular version as well.  I am still debating if the waterproofing is worth keeping them or not.
review.name: Waterproof but uncomfortable

name: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace an older version that finally became too chewed up to resole.  I was pleased to see that Scarpa has updated the design a bit from my original ones.  They are quite a bit lighter, and they revamped the midsole and lacing system, but they have basically the same last and fit.  The boots are great, and the Scarpa quality remains top notch.  These are true mountaineering boots, and are quite stiff, but I found as I've gotten older, I've found that my feet hold up better with a beefier boot, so I have found myself wearing the Charmoz for hikes and scrambles I might have done in approach shoes many years ago.  Scarpa has just the right amount of rocker in this boot to make it a very good hiker in broken and rocky terrain.  As an aside, my old Charmoz fit perfectly at 41, and the new ones fit equally well except in size 42.  In truth, I think that's my feet getting bigger as I've gotten older (I'm 65) rather than Scarpa's sizing.
review.name: Consistently good design

name: Charmoz Mountaineering Boot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lazer Impala Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the small matte light blue but had previously purchased a medium elsewhere.  The medium felt a bit large, but I could have worn either with the adjustment.  I liked the smaller profile of the small so am sticking with that.  Anyhow, I do not personally feel they run small.

I have almost given up seeking a helmet that both looks decent and fits but isn't huge.  POC helmets make me look like I have an alien head.  I have loved the Bell Super Helmet fit but haven't seen any new colors I like.  I am really glad this one fits.

I did also order another style Lazer helmet in a "Small/Medium", and it my head looked huge.  This fits quite nicely.  I also love the color options...so sick of black helmets.
review.name: Finally!  I love this helmet!

review.reviewBody: This is a nice lightweight helmet that has a very solid construction, the venting keeps me cool and I dont get drippy sweat when its real hot! Its great if you have alot of hair but I would size up, as I am usually a medium in TLD,smith, and giro. I got a medium and its just a bit snug. Still very comfy!
review.name: Lightweight  and great for mops

review.reviewBody:
This is a great helmet! It feels very light and fits snuggly. I like the adjustable visor, and it has lots of vent. The dial in the back is easily adjustable for a secure fit. I like that it comes with a light and GoPro mount to fit on top if you want. 

I tend to fit right on the upper end of the size small helmets and often debate between small or medium. I got this one in small, and it just barely fits. It likely fits just a tad small to size, but I think the medium would have been too big for me!
review.name: Solid all around helmet!

review.reviewBody:
Would be perfect if it fit my head.  I think my head is more round shaped?  Pretty wide.  Giro helmets I have worn fit real nice.  This is just too tight above the ears got some pressure points in that area.

If I had the head for this helmet I would love it.  Seems really breathable, lots of vents, looks good, dial is easy and quick to adjust.

I normally stick sunglasses upside down somewhere in the back vents, could be the shades I tried but I couldn't find a comfortable or sturdy way to store them with the vents on here
review.name: Great if it fit

review.reviewBody:
The Lazer Impala is a great helmet so far. Admittedly I haven't used it yet in the heat but the extra venting allows for more breathability and keeps the helmet feeling light and good addition to my gear for Arizona riding.

I like the adjustable visor which has come in handy keeping the sun off of my eyes on westward evening ascents. I have a POC Ventral Air as well and this one feels more solid in the build, as far as it's construction and adjustable fit dials in the back. 

Aesthetically, the helmet looks good and doesn't feel too big on my head. I got the Matte Blue Green, but I like the look of the Red/White version as well.

All in all a solid helmet.
review.name: Riding with the Impala

review.reviewBody: I have used this helmet several times now. The helmet fits great and the adjustment system is very sturdy feeling to get that perfect fit on your head. The padding inside the helmet is also super comfortable making it feel like it is barely there. Adding onto that is the lightweight and lower profile of the helmet making it feel and look good on your head. A nice benefit is the included gopro mount so if you do get out at night you have an easy mounting point for a light. Overall a great fitting and feeling helmet!
review.name: Helmet Feels Great

review.reviewBody:
A helmet that fits great with a nice low profile.  You will forget this helmet is on your head, and it won't make you look like a cartoon Martian.

The fit is slightly oval in my opinion, and true to size.  It sits fairly deep but still leaves plenty of room for any size sunglasses. The visor adjusts so that you can stow your glasses in the helmet if needed.

A nice add on is the included light/gopro mount.  It can be removed, or integrated seamlessly. 

This is a 5 star helmet all the way!
review.name: Looks Good

review.reviewBody: I have had this helmet for a couple of weeks now and I love it! It vents well and the tightening system works really well to keep the helmet down snug. I have a lot of hair so a good tightening system is key for my helmets they have to be able to tighten down enough to keep the helmet snug without making it uncomfortable with all my hair. I do want to echo what previous reviews have mentioned, the strap is a bit on the short side so if you are in-between sizes I would size up to give you that extra room.
review.name: Solid Helmet

review.reviewBody: Overall Superslick helmet! Love this fit, feels like it's wrapped around my head instead of just placed on top. The DIal on the back really holds my head well. Also came with a light/GoPro mount that fits on the top. Can not recommend the helmet enough!
review.name: Great lid!

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of this helmet. First of all, the color options are great to match most any kit. The fit is accurate with the sizing chart and works well for my oval head shape. I will say that compared to my previous IXS helmet, this one looks larger on my head. Maybe that's because my old helmet doesn't have MIPS. It all evens out and looks good when you're on the bike though. Also, as another reviewer mentioned, the chin strap is not the best quality, fit, or feel. Compared to my old IXS, it feels cheaper and doesn't have any soft-touch cover over the excess strap material below the chin. Overall, the helmet is still an upgrade from my old helmet, with safer MIPS, and although it's a larger overall size, it is still lightweight. I also really like the adjustable visor - very helpful in low-angle light! For the price, this is a top-level helmet that any level of rider will love!
review.name: Great all-around MTB helmet!

name: Impala Mips Helmet
Impala Mips Helmet

Buy the DOD Outdoors Uma Folding Wagon online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Uma Folding Wagon
hasVariant.description: Buy the DOD Outdoors Uma Folding Wagon online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
For the past year I have been kicking the tires on every wagon I've seen, asking the owners about what they love and don't love about their wagons, and been avidly reading reviews online. Finally, this week, I carefully made my choice and bought DOD Outdoors' Uma Folding Wagon. It is exceptional! 
I will be using it for camping, road trips (so done with luggage carts), dragging things around to concerts, neighbourhood parties and our gardens, and catering. 
What I love about it: powder coated steel, small footprint folded, logical and intelligent construction, supremely sturdy over-landing wheels with brakes (having had first quality beach carts before, I am done with dreaming about rolling over sand), 350 load capacity (I believe them), goldilocks size of cart - just perfect,  washable cover, great looks (matches my fancy tent don't you know), and fast delivery. The handle is comfortable for my tall guy as well as for me.
Based on the fantastic quality of the wagon I bought the optional oak table top, which I think will be very useful indeed for use as a carrying deck (60lbs) as well as a table. For now, I have the wagon fully loaded with Christmas presents for wheeling out on the day. 
I could not be happier about my purchase and am now checking out the DOD outdoor inventory to see what else I might need for my adventures.
review.name: Love, LOVE this beautiful workhorse!

name: Uma Folding Wagon

review.reviewBody: weight is featherweight, straps are an amazing design and the grip is awesome! These are very well made snowshoes and i'm happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great snowshoes!

review.reviewBody: Just got the latest 2022 design and returned it due to crushing force exerted by the front strap. Would probably be fine with hard toe boots, but mine have a pliable toe box where the strap tightens over the ball of the foot. I tried for an hour moving foot position back and forth but there was always pressure on the outside toes that I’m sure would be painful by the end of a hike. Pretty and lightweight though.
review.name: Binding crushes forefoot

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are nice, the new entry system is a wiz and the Straps are a bit small.

Unfortunately, the shoes broke shortly after purchase due to a failed pin.
review.name: The pin broke 2km on first use

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for the guys in my family as they were hesitant to go snowshoeing with me because of the hassle they always felt with traditional bindings. No more complaints and whining, lol, now that they have the Lightning Explore! These ones are so simple, only 2 straps, click in place, stay firmly closed even when breaking trail in deep new snow. No issues with these at all.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I bought this pair snowshoes. On the third hike, the notched straps have loosened. to be continued....
review.name: the notched straps

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these snow shoes a couple of weeks ago and took them for the first time this week. About an hour and change into the day, I noticed one of the bindings had become very floppy . I removed the snowshoe and discovered that the pin holding the binding to the frame had sheared off. I cut the trip short and had to posthole in mid calf snow for about a mile to get to a more firm surface for the return to my car.

I contacted MSR immediately, and to their credit, they were very responsive. Apparently the "clevis pin" which holds the binding to the snowshoe came off. Based on the photos i provided, they said "all you needed was a clevis pin, and you'd've been back in business" and that "this is a rare case/doesn't happen often. " I wouldn't expect to need to carry a "clevis pin" as a spare part the next time I snowshoe.

Bottom line: I like the ratcheting system which makes shoe/boot adjustment much easier for those with arthritic hands (like myself) I think MSR has a design problem here. I would have rated the product one star, but I appreciate the prompt customer followup, so two stars it is. And I would definitely order some "clevis pins" along with the snowshoes.
review.name: Bad design, decent company follow up

review.reviewBody:
the straps are easy to remove. It lacks a strap in the middle. I added it personally. best outfit super satisfied. good flotation on the snow. I can't say anything about sustainability.
It's difficult to descend in a straight line on a certain slope.
review.name: Best from two world

review.reviewBody: I added a second binding near the ankle. It share the traction points
review.name: with a second HyperLink bindings, the best

review.reviewBody: I use these for fun and on the SAR team , they hold great in mixed conditions. and I can rotate the shoes for long side slope crossings . the Easy in and out make a big difference when things get "" urgent""
review.name: Great for varied conditions with ice and snow

review.reviewBody: Great product. Bindings are secure yet easy to put on and take off.
review.name: Great!

name: Lightning Explore Snowshoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love this vest. I wear it every day in the colder months.
review.name: Must buy

review.reviewBody: As always, NF down vest is of high quality at a reasonable price.
review.name: Great light weight vest for layering when it's cold out.

review.reviewBody: Love this vest! I wear it multiple times a week. It fits great, wears well outside & even in a casual work environment. A friend of mine has this vest & I pined for it for over a year. So glad I finally bought it for myself!
review.name: Best Vest

review.reviewBody: I like this vest. It's my 3rd time purchasing it. I wish the zipper was made of more durable material (i.e. metal not plastic.) But besides that, I love it. For reference I am 5'2" 195lbs and ordered an XL. It fits with enough room to wear bulky hoodies underneath.
review.name: Comfy Vest

review.reviewBody: Fit perfectly fine .True to size ,mother in law loved it . Might get me one for myself in a Men's version .Texture / Quality is very good , I have bought myself 2 other products honestly very amazing
review.name: I would buy this product again and again !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Number one vest for everyday use. During all four seasons
review.name: I would buy this product in the next few years again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This vest is a beautiful blue and pairs nicely with Karan's, leggings and casual pants. It has a flattering fit and as a bonus folds up small for travel. This is my second vest.
review.name: Perfect vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear this for extra protection, in extreme weather I wear my Northface down vest. This one is lighter easily packed in a travel bag.

They are super light weight, surprisingly warm, and thin enough so you can easily layer up without feeling bulky. I have one in nearly every color! I would definitely recommend this product. description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: I purchased this so I could use it with Zwift and my Wahoo Kickr. The heart rate monitor works great and lasts a long time on each charge. I like that it came with two options for the bands depending on where you want to wear it or wrist size.
review.name: Perfect for tracking heartrate.

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: This armband monitor seems to work really well.  Easy to put on, stays in place, and monitors consistently and accurately for me.  No problems with Bluetooth like other reviewers have mentioned.  I connect to my iPhone directly (when indoor training) and also my Wahoo Mini (when riding outside) with no issues.
review.name: Really happy so far!

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody:
Always found chest straps restrictive.  Wrist HRM are uncomfortable for me, but better than chest.  Forearm is perfect - I forget it's there.
No issues syncing to ANT+ and Zwift, to Garmin bike computers, and to CatEye bike computers.  Discovered immediately.  No fuss.
The only downside is yet another device-specific charger.  Also, if you want to buy replacement straps, Wahoo forces you to buy both sizes in a 2-pack, instead of just one or two of the same size.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: I hate chest straps, so I was excited to get my TICKR FIT and use it.  When it works properly, I love it.  The problem is, it's inconsistent.  To Wahoo's credit, they replaced it - twice - and I've continued to have the same issues with the replacements as the original.  Also, I've experienced the same issues when connected to a Wahoo BOLT as I do with my new Garmin 830... so its definitely the TICKR FIT that is the issue and not the bike computer(s).  The issue is that sometimes the FIT will just stop responding - and drop out - OR it'll keep sending the bike computer the same heartrate measurement and not change.  i.e. I come to a stop and drink and what-not and it's still broadcasting that my HR is 175.... or I'll do a hard climb and it'll still be broadcasting that my HR is 110.  It doesn't do this all the time, but it does it enough that it's infuriating and makes me hate the device.  I really am not a fan of chest straps, so I continue to use the FIT... but I'll eventually replace it with another brand and be done with this thing.  I honestly wouldn't buy another until they work out the connectivity kinks.
review.name: Wish it worked better

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody:
Setup was a pain with my Nokia 7.1, but worked well with other phone. After firmware update on the bolt, it also connected with the 7.1
Could have told me before that I get sent a pink one..
Except for that, just positive experience
review.name: First setup impossible with Nokia 7.1

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: Great product ! Good to buy product totally fine and as new as possible.
review.name: Great product and good or the planet !

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: Great Product and great band, can't be more happier with the technical support and the quality of the products.
review.name: Like a New Product

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: Ive been using Wahoo sensors for years (as the smell of my heart strap will show). They have worked flawlessly so buying the bolt was an obvious choice. Not disappointed. Works flawlessly to the extent, I dont know how I managed with my old cycle computer. Its simply well thought out and clearly designed by riders for riders
review.name: Not disappointed

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: Easy to set up with the companion app and easy file in- and export. Speed measurement with gps with high variation. Recommend extra sensor. Hight measurnent is good but high difference between accumulated up and down hight. When file is exported to oruxmaps hight measurment is exact. Map is good. Following a track works perfekt. Gps accuracy is also very good.
review.name: Element Bolt

review.itemreviewed: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband
review.reviewBody: You'd get five star if you didn't have to buy Strava summit to get Garmin levels of synchronisation.
review.name: Great (but requires Strava summit)

name: TICKR FIT Optical Heart Rate Monitor Armband

review.reviewBody: I have a pretty normal/narrow foot and these were so painfully tight in the body of the boot yet loose in the heel, so my foot was pinching and heel coming up when I took a step, I run a true 9.5 as well and have other frye boots that fit perfectly. such a bummer because I love the style so much :(

review.reviewBody: The opening of the boot was so small I couldn’t get my foot inside the boot. The boot itself ran big when I placed my foot alongside the outside of the boot. I wear a B width shoe. Perhaps a narrow foot wouldn’t encounter this problem.

review.reviewBody: Please tell me my pair is defective.How does any one wear these boots? They are beyond painful.

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair last year in black. Had to buy a brown pair this year. So soft and so comfortable. I normally wear a 6.5 to 7. The first pair I bought a 6.5. Too tight on my foot. Gave them to my daughter and have 7’s in both now. Perfect.
review.name: Love love love

description: Buy the Metolius Safe Tech Deluxe Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Safe Tech Deluxe Harness - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Metolius Safe Tech Deluxe Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
originally bought this because my gym harness was sagging when loaded up with a double rack. the deluxe has no issues in that arena. their quick adjust buckle never slips under the weight, but is still easy to loosen when nature calls. the double belay loops are great for keeping things organized like a PAS on one and belay device on the other. i’m mostly happy with the comfort, not really a harness you’ll forget you’re wearing due to the size and weight, but hanging belays less than 45 min aren’t a problem. as for durability, it’s bullet proof. i climb crack and offwidth as often as possible and i think a lot of “cutting edge” harnesses would be shredded by now.

minus one star because: 
i really dislike the leg loop suspension system, the way it attaches with those buttons and the material itself, lack of adjustability…just dumb

i dislike the quick adjust strap isn’t sewn the entire length of the padding, i know it’s for adjustability, but it makes a big padded tongue that’s always twisted or flopping around

but those aren’t deal breakers for me, would def buy another one
review.name: mostly amazing

name: Safe Tech Deluxe Harness - Men's

review.reviewBody: My daughter got this vest for me and I love it! Good vest. Only complaint is the stiffness of the collar. It rubs under the chin and will not flatten. But other than that I love it highly recommend this vest will be purchasing another one just a different color!
review.name: Great Vest!

review.reviewBody: The collar won't stay folded. I wish it had a hood.

I work outside and almost all if not all of my work clothes and outerwear are made by Carhartt. I have two of these vests and my only complaint is the collar. It stabs me in the chin making them uncomfortable to wear. I also have the Sherpa lined mock neck vests that are much more comfortable to wear. These are the only Carhartt products that I have ever had a complaint about, wish they would do something to fix it as apparently quite a few people have said the same thing.
review.name: Collar needs improvement

review.reviewBody: Definitely would recommend,great fit good looking well made and comfortable

When I tried this on in the Store I loved The Material ! The reason I did not buy was because of the Collar as many are telling you here.My old Carhartt Black Vest Model 0V4395-M I wear every day of the year because of the pockets .Its really starting to show its wear,But has served me well... Even in the summer! I also have the Extremes Jacket ! I would love this Super Dux vest with the rib knit collar....I am probably going to pick up the Gilliam vest for now as well. But please make this with the shorter collar. Thanks for Great products....

review.reviewBody: Great product. The fit is perfect and the color is even nicer than in the picture. The pockets are great!
review.name: Love Carhartt Clothes

review.reviewBody: Fits well, pockets well placed and easy to use.  Well made.  Warm.
review.name: I really like it.

review.reviewBody: Good vest.  Only complaint is the stiffness of the collar. It rubs under the chin and will not flatten.
My second Carhartt purchase. Love your jackets! Plan to buy many more.

I received this vest for Christmas and really liked it. It moves with your body as opposed to other duck vest where they take awhile to break in. Keeps you warm without over heating you. I would agree with others on the collar can be a little bother some I took a towel and placed it over collar with an iron to try and press it down into place. It seemed to help. But I would recommend maybe putting some snap buttons under the collar to keep them down and out of your face as I like to where mine folded down and not popped up. Other then that I really like mine.

hasVariant.name: Tubeless Sealant + Twist Lock Applicator
hasVariant.description: Buy the Orange Seal Tubeless Sealant + Twist Lock Applicator online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Over the last season, I had a plethora of issues using Stans Notubes, and thought I'd give Orange a try.  I've used it over the last 45 days and haven't had any seepage - I've found the viscosity of Orange is a bit higher vs Stans (think: less juice pushing through the sidewalls).  It sealed without issue, and I was even able to get my tire to seat correctly with a floor pump, which is usually difficult for me when using Stans.  To boot, the included "hose" apparatus is a great inclusion that makes adding fluid easy.  I plan on keeping this small bottle + hose, and refilling it with a larger container over time for easy of use.
review.name: Great Juice

name: Tubeless Sealant + Twist Lock Applicator

review.reviewBody: I have been hiking in Los Lionos Canyon for the last fifty years since I was seventeen, and this hiking shoe is fantastic ... the fit and feel of the shoe on the trail ... I know where my foot is, and I can feel the terrain. Going uphill or downhill, there's plenty of grip. The tongue has enough padding, so f you need to lace your shoes tightly to lock them in, you're set. I have a bright red color. Did I mention they are featherweight-light? These hiking shoes are remarkable. Would I get them again... yes, indeed.
review.name: Superb Hiking Shoe

review.reviewBody: Wear them for work on my feet all day working. I do flooring and toes protected I LOVE THEM
review.name: So comfortable well worth the money

review.reviewBody:
The Aero Glide 2 and the Ultra Flow both have a rigid ankle that digs into my ankles.
On my left foot, left side, on both.

I wish they would lower or redesign the rigidity on these models. Because I love the style and almost everything else about them.
review.name: Hard ankle digs into my ankle
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: I bought these “running” shoes even though I’m not a runner. I love walking and they are perfect for me and super comfortable!
review.name: Fantastic walking shoes!

review.reviewBody: Very satisfied with these shoes. Purchased about a month ago and have been wearing them primarily for work on Concrete floors (lots of standing and walking) all day, and my feet have been much happier. I tried other high cushion shoes like Hoka's, but these have been MUCH better.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Seems great; just wish for a wider forefoot. While my old Salomon XA boots had a very comfortable, wider forefoot, all of these running/hiking shoes seem to run narrow. Great for many; not for those who need more room up front.
review.name: Wish for a wider forefoot.
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody:
These were nice shoes. I wanted them to work for me but they didn’t not fit properly for me. My feet are short in length, but steep on top. Size 7.5 typically. 
The length of the shoes fit perfect, but the sides of the shoe did not go high enough, and the tongue was not wide enough. So basically the shoe was “open” on the sides of the tongue even when tied. If they had a wide version that may have worked for me. 
But unfortunately I had to return these. 
Return process is easy with Backcountry though.
review.name: Nice shoe but runs small for 7.5

review.reviewBody:
10 km’s per day of walking or light hiking with my Labrador. Light, solid, visually cool and so far holding up. I’ve been wearing nothing but Salomon shoes and hiking boots (4 purchases per year) for the past 5 years. 

Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect comfort and price point
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are happy to know that these shoes have been a great match.

review.reviewBody: First off I do like the shoes. They are comfortable and like everything Salomon seem to be well built. After using the SpeedCross 6 and other Hiking Shoes and Boots for years, these would be a no brainer to try. Maybe it's just me but the drop definitely feels lower than a 6mm but that could be from the roll up on the back (and coming from the SpeedCross and Boots). I also don't think they are quite as "plush" as they are marketed to be with "maximal cushioning". Not bad cushioning, just not as much as you'd expect. First run was 4.5 miles and the shoe locked down nicely and made no hot spots. Contagrip performed well as expected, almost felt sticky when on pavement. The upper is super breathable, first time in a while I've felt air through a shoe and thin merino socks. Long term durability will attest to the value, but starting out I would expect them to last quite a while.  The sole is quite flexible to contour and grip the terrain, but keep that in mind if you are going to run on old railbed, maintained trails or roads. These aren't mud warriors, and they're not road warriors. Just a good all around light trail shoe.
review.name: Good Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have been running, hiking and walking with Salomon shoes for a long time and the Ultra Flow will keep me coming back. Very comfortable and lots of cushion. My only issue is that they seem to seem to run slightly big.
review.name: Lots of cushion.

name: Ultra Flow Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The Gazelle T10 is a very nice all around use e-bike. The upright seating position and high quality bike seat make for a comfortable ride especially with the mono suspension steering post. The Bosch Motor is reliable and seamless in the pedaling boost. The e-assist range is very good and it allows for potential long rides. Sturdy, nice quality, good looking bike is a pleasure to ride. The step through frame makes for easy on and off.  The lights are really helpful and convenient as an automatic feature which is always there and ready.
review.name: Very fine E-bike

name: Ultimate T10 E-Bike

review.reviewBody: Would be great light weight shorts, but way shorter than they should be. The Tech specs box says under the heading, Length: "Knee". The product pic shows them above the knee on the model, which I assume is probably around 6'. I'm only 5'7" and they were like 3" above the knee. And because they are a bit of a slim fit, they rode up a lot more with every step.
review.name: Much shorter than expected.

review.reviewBody: But I never received them and Backcountry did nothing to help resolve the issue.
review.name: They looked great

review.reviewBody:
I now have three pairs of these Shorts. Each in a different color. I purchased them because they have a back pocket and nowadays it’s very hard to find a tennis short with a back pocket for putting your wallet in after your workout.  I purposely bought the shorts too big so I can get tennis balls in the front left pocket. The pockets are deep enough to hold  a couple of tennis balls securely. 
The downside of this short is the material always looks wrinkly and the pockets gather up at the bottom seams of the pockets.  When I wear the shorts it looks like I had them crumpled up in a drawer.  I don’t care because they function perfectly for my needs.
review.name: The Shorts Work for Tennis Too

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It looks great, the quality looks great! Looks a little simple, tho. But excellent value for the price.
review.name: Nice shorts!

review.reviewBody: These are more universal mountain shorts; great on the trail, good enough to go swimming and dry out quickly, etc.  Whatever you want to do, these are awesome for the most part.  I wouldn't wear them in the bike park, they don't play well with hard crashes and rocks.
review.name: Universal Shorts (Swim/Hike/Run/etc)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use these for hiking. They are light and fit well. They look great.
review.name: I would buy these again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice shorts. Overall comfy for daily wear. Wish they had the shorter version in stock.
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] LOVE LOVE LOVE these shorts. Have them in 4 colors. 2 Pairs of each. Keep a set in my RV for when we are away and another set at home. They are the MOST comfortable and easy to wear I have ever owned.
review.name: Can't Say Enough GOOD things about these shorts.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shorts but needed to size down as they run big
review.name: Great but runs big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The waist is unusually big for the size, otherwise they seem like decent shorts

review.reviewBody: The pad of the tights is very comfortable and i've done 4 hour rides with no discomfort on the saddle at all. I very much like the material of the tights which do keep me snug and warm in high 40' and low 50's. Overall I really enjoyed this product and for the price I wouldn't spend anything more seeing that this one does everything perfectly for me. One thing is that the shoulder straps are a bit tight but honestly you forget about it and don't even feel it as soon as you're riding on the bike. Be aware with sizing as I'm glad I sized up, so you should too.
review.name: Great product for the price

review.reviewBody: Perfect for fall riding in Vermont.  Fits snug.  Stretches.  Excellent quality.  Dries quickly.  I wear this under a thin stretch jacket for 55 degree weather.  With a base layer for 45 degree weather.
review.name: Great Thermal Shirt

review.reviewBody:
Bought this to keep me warm in late fall/early spring weather in Chicago (down to around/below freezing with terrible winds), and it's been great. The fit is great and close to the skin - just a step below full-on race cut. But it's not perfect:
- The cuffs on the sleeves aren't elastic enough, so there's often a gap between the sleeves and gloves, letting cold wind in - having thumb straps would be an easy fix.
- The shoulders need more padding, perhaps wind-proofing them would be great; I found myself feeling very cold there, although my core was toasty.
- The collar is incredibly tight and almost makes you feel like you're choking, especially when going hard.
- The pockets are tiny and don't stretch nearly enough. Fitting a phone, wallet, and Clif bar in any one of the pockets is a squeeze. Forget about a vest/jacket.
review.name: Great fit, plenty warm, but not perfect

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'9" 177 LBS. I'm not a very thin person like some cyclist, my body type is more on the athletic side since I like hitting the gym very frequently. Have a big chest and decent sized back. I ordered a LARGE SIZE and it fit me perfect. I ordered the yellow jersey, it looks great, was very comfy, kept my body warm and the material was awesome. This jersey is true to size, unlike Castilli where a lot of their attire runs very small.
review.name: Great Fit, True to Size !

review.reviewBody: I am 6'-2", 200 pounds, 36 waist. I bought an extra large per the chart and comments. The XL size I received I would call at best at Medium, impossible to even zip up. Too bad, it seems like a very nice jersey that I would like. This is definitely not true to size. Even accounting for it is designed to form fit.
review.name: Too small

name: C5 Thermo Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.name: Dominator FTS Crash Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ocun Dominator FTS Crash Pad online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I didn't realize how clunky and non-breathable my crash pads were until this one came into my life. Am I being dramatic? No, truly. The Dominator is a game-changer for falls, comfort, and compactness. There *is* one specific pro that comes with a con...it's water resistant (dope!) but the material that Ocún uses to achieve this slides on snow (doh). This is only an issue in alpine environments when the snow hasn't melted yet. Maybe just don't use it for the pad that you jump onto after topping out a boulder. Still, 5 stars in my book.
review.name: New Standard for Crash Pads

review.reviewBody: For how thick this pad is, its super light and easy to carry.  It's inside tech also makes it the best for jumping onto from high up, so I always make people move it to the top of a pad pile if I have to jump down! it absorbs impact so much better than other pads I've used.
review.name: Super light pad

name: Dominator FTS Crash Pad

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear White Peak/2 Down Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: White Peak/2 Down Parka - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear White Peak/2 Down Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I was so excited about this jacket, it appeared to be exactly what I was looking for – a traditional ski parka but with extra warmth. I am so disappointed. I have to ask what we’re you thinking?! Worst thing first, the length of the sleeves, they are way too short. I have small arms and the sleeves don’t even make it to my wrist. There is no way I’ll ever have a tight seal over my gloves. There are other obvious misses like no powder skirt or ticket pocket but the sleeves! Wow, how could you miss this so badly. I’ll be returning this jacket.
review.name: Sleeves way, way too short. Not suitable for skiing.

review.reviewBody: Originally purchased the size S, my normal size, but exchanged for the M as I wanted to wear a fleece underneath.  I’m 5’4” 120 and wanted enough room to not feel uncomfortable.  The sleeves on the M also better for cinching over gloves.  I love the 2 way zipper and side snaps.  The soft fabric around my chin when zipped is a really nice feature as are all the pockets. I read  a complaint below about this not being waterproof.  True, but it is water resistant, the website should clarify the different types of Gore-Tex.  I just returned from a several mile hike in snow and wintry mix and water beaded up and slid off.
review.name: Everything I wanted in a Jacket to wear around town and the forest

review.reviewBody: Gore-TEX Infinium products are not waterproof, it's water resistant!!!  I checked Gore-TEX Product Range:  Gore-Tex "Infinium" is "High-performance NON-waterproof technologies"
review.name: Not waterproof - Gore-Tex "Infinium" is water resistant only

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this jacket. I am usually a medium and that's what I ordered - there's still plenty of room to layer underneath without the jacket feeling at all bulky. It's also super warm. If anything, it's been a little too warm on some days, but that's fine. Way better than not being warm enough. Highly recommend.
review.name: Warm as ever!

name: White Peak/2 Down Parka - Women's

hasVariant.name: Retro Denali Vest - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Retro Denali Vest - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great jacket! Perfect to throw in a duffel bag for a camping trip great quality and fit!
review.name: I like this so much that I bought two more

review.reviewBody: Great quality vest! Awesome for every day wear and is super warm!
review.name: Best vest I've purchased

review.reviewBody: I have owned 2 other colors of this vest and finally acquired one in all black. All of them are just the absolute best to wear especially during the early spring and all throughout the fall season. I love that it has a relax cut/fit to it. So, if you decide you want to wear a sweater hoodie instead of a t-shirt hoodie, it won't feel/fit too snug on you.
review.name: One of the BEST vest's out there!!!

review.reviewBody: I have a vest for layering during the cold months and for basic warmth in the spring and fall. Extremely disappointing product. I have had two of these and with both items the zipper broke within a few months of Purchasing and the process of having the warranty team investigate the issue and replace or fix the product is a nightmare and takes nearly 2 months. For the money you spend you'd expect a high quality product to last years, but that is not the case. Average quality and not worth the money or hassle.
review.name: Don't waste your money

review.reviewBody: Denali vest is great to work outdoors. I bought mine to get ready for the fall/winter season at the airport. Keeping the core warm is very important during freezing temperatures. Thank you North Face!
review.name: Top notch quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use it when I'm at work and personally. Fits fine and with the sleeves missing you won't get too hot when it heats up a little.
review.name: Great choice!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great vest. I use it to complete my outfits, truly completes the look.
review.name: Best Vest.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the best vest ever. I have owned this style vest for over 20 years. TNF stopped producing it about 10 years ago, and I have been patiently waiting for it to come back.
review.name: I will buy this over and over again. Love this vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This vest is great for those days where a coat is too much. light yet warm and very comfortable.
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this Jacket! It fits perfectly and looks great and is actually very comfortable and warm!
review.name: I would definitely recommend

name: Retro Denali Vest - Men's
